Getting into SV was life-changing and wonderful for me, but it wasn't the end. After that I still had a lot of growing to do. It makes me reflect on the stuff @AustenAllred and @amasad are doing, enabling support networks -> huge social opportunities.
I think about how much more effective I've been recently - a big part of that is more experience, but equally-if-not-moreso is the support network I've built up over the past decade.
Also, the past few weeks have really highlighted that any success I have is/will be from friends who supported me when it didn't make much rational sense to.

One thing I've been reflecting on WRT my actions and their results, a few maxims seem to pop out. One that came to mind today:Be humble, but not intimidated. You're much more effective and helpful that way.
Also thanks to @zaiste for pointing out  https://github.com/hlissner/doom-emacs … - it looks like a really well-done minimal Emacs setup https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rCMh7srOqvw&feature=youtu.be …
But wow, @spacemacs is just so good.
